reporting-org.narrative: Environmental Centre for Oil Spills and Gas Flaring (NACGOND)

title.narrative: Advocacy visit to Cross River State Forestry Commission to Seek Tree Planting Partnership

description.narrative: Based on the recommendations of the midterm evaluation report that, the engagement with the National Youths Service Corps which failed to synergise as planned be suspended, the budgeted sum for it was used for this activity. As such, the advocacy visit was planned to foster unity between NACGOND and the forestry commission in response to the outcome from quarterly visits to the community environmental club in Boki where members requested for assistance to get indigenous tree species from the commission for planting in areas affected by deforestation. Boki Local Government in Cross River State remains one of the areas housing Nigeria’s remaining rain forests. However, of recent, incessant logging activities in the forest creates anxiety whether the rain forest would remain what it is in the nearest future since it inhabits some endangered species as the Cross River Gorilla. It was based on this and likely impact which deforestation in Boki could have on climate change that the visit was initiated.

participating-org.narrative: National Coalitionon Gas Flaring and Oil Spills n Nier Delta

owner-org.narrative: This activity which was originally designed to harness the human resources within the National Youths Service Corps, NYSC for community level climate change sensitization was stopped midway due to the recommendation of the midterm evaluation report. As such, the budget was used for advocacy to the Cross River State Forestry Commission seeking partnership for tree planting in Boki Local Government Area of Cross River State.

activity-date.narrative: Two visits were made, one to deliver the advocacy letter and the second to hold meeting with the Chairman, Cross River State Forestry Commission, Calabar.

organisation.narrative: All inquiries at directed to the National Coordinator of NACGOND.

recipient-country.narrative: This activity took place in Calabar, the capital of Cross River State.

sector.narrative: This activity falls under forestry policy where trees would be planted in areas with deforestation in Boki Local Government Area.

title.narrative: Achieved Partnership with the Cross River State Forestry Commission on tree planting.

description.narrative: Though there was no immediate action taken to commence nursery of identified species of trees requested by community members, the meeting guaranteed future opportunity for stakeholder networking for tree planting which would lead to building of community resilience to climate change in the project area.

title.narrative: The meeting between NACGOND and the Cross River State Forestry Commission held with both stakeholders agreeing to partner inn tree planting activities in Boki Local Government Area of the state.
